column4: i was messing with gnome themes and i clicked on a kubuntu icon pack.....now gnome is hosed.   i cant find any way to bring it back..... can anyone help?
hosed? what jappened
if i try to run gnome-theme-manager i get gtk warnings and it crashes
is there a .conf file i can revert?
ok try running them in a terminal..maybe use xterm or failsafe for that..you ll get the verbose output
uninstall the troublesome theme pack
(gtk-theme-switch2:22460): Gtk-WARNING **: Theme file for tango has no directories
how do i uninstall it though when i cant run the theme manager
look in ./gnome..sorry mate dont use gnome
what am i looking for
: just a sec
ok
the theme in question, is it locally installed?
i think so, i never tried doing anything else
hmm..ok 'cd .icons'
i see it in /usr/share/icons
check whether the troublesome icon theme is sitting there
oh great...move it to some where else..
the directory, or the index.theme?
thanks
im pretty sure i got it now
have a good one
that was very helpful
cheers ^_^
